title: Avoid Dangerous Water Substitutes
brief: Recognize liquids that should never be substituted for water as they can worsen dehydration or cause harm.
steps: Step 1: Never drink urine as a water substitute - it concentrates body waste products.
Step 2: Avoid drinking blood which contains high salt content that increases dehydration.
Step 3: Do not drink seawater - the salt content will rapidly worsen dehydration.
Step 4: Avoid alcoholic beverages which act as diuretics and increase water loss.
Step 5: Do not drink fish juices or other body fluids from animals.
Step 6: Stick to clear, fresh water sources or properly distilled/purified water.
warnings: These fluids will worsen dehydration rather than help it.
Drinking urine, blood, or seawater can cause kidney damage.
Alcohol increases water loss through increased urination.
source: FM21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army (Chapter 6 - Water Procurement)
